title: PHOTO: Mahama’s Competitor Shows Off His Presidential Nomination Form
content:
NDC’s George Boateng has exposed his party’s General Secretary, Johnson Asiedu Nketiah for alleging that he has not picked his presidential nomination form to challenge President John Dramni Mahama in the party’s November 7th primaries.

Asiedu Nketiah, affectionately called in politics as “General Mosquito” was blunt on NEAT FM when he denied publications with picture evidence that the NDC’s Presidential candidate aspirant, George Boateng, has picked his nomination form at the party’s headquarters.

”Since we [NDC] opened the nomination for the presidential election, no single person has come to my office for the form. I am the only person who can issue out the presidential form to candidates, with the parliamentary, candidates can go to their constituency secretary for the form. I was told yesterday [Monday] that George Boateng has visited the party office for the form…but I told my clerks to hold on because I am not at the office,” - the General said 

George Boateng who maintained he has picked his form was unable to show ‘clearly’ the real presidential nomination form since the only picture evidence was him with an elderly person handling over a ‘brown envelope’ to him [George] in an office. 

However, the presidential aspirant has now revealed the ‘real’ form with the party’s logo [Umbrella] boldly embossed in it. 

Would Asiedu Nketiah still deny the authenticity of the form from the man he described as – “mentally disabled”?
